Class LightGameObject

  • java.lang.Object

extends org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.gameobject.GameObject

    See Also:

      • LightGameObject

        public LightGameObject(org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.data.Light.Type type,
                       org.joml.Vector3f color,
                       float intensity)
        Same as LightGameObject(Light), but calls the Light(Light.Type, Vector3f, float) constructor itself.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of the light
        color - - color of the light
        intensity - - intensity of the light
        See Also:
        Light, Light(Light.Type, Vector3f, float))

    • Method Detail

      • getLight

        public org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.data.Light getLight()

      • writeToBuffer

        public void writeToBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buff,
                          int offset)
        Writes all the data from this object to a buffer for rendering use. Uses std140 alignment of the GLSL struct:
        
 struct Light {
        mat4 transform;
        vec3 color;
        float intensity;
        int type;
};
        Parameters:
        buff - - buffer for the data to be put into
        offset - - offset into the buffer to put the data
        See Also:
        ByteBuffer

      • getSize

        public static int getSize()
        Get the size of the GLSL struct: 
        
 struct Light {
        mat4 transform;
        vec3 color;
        float intensity;
        int type;
 };
        Returns:
        the size assuming the alignment is std140

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the object. updates the Transformation and Light data in the scene buffers if the object is in a Scene
        Overrides:
        update in class org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.gameobject.GameObject
        See Also:
        Scene, GameObject.isInScene()

      • getSceneBufferOffset

        public int getSceneBufferOffset()
        offset in the Scene lights buffer where the object is written.
        Returns:
        -1 if the object is not registered in a Scene, otherwise an integer between 0 and the length of the OpenGL buffer getSceneBuffer()

      • setSceneBufferOffset

        public void setSceneBufferOffset(int sceneBufferOffset)
        Do not use this unless you really know what you're doing!
        Parameters:
        sceneBufferOffset -
        See Also:
        getSceneBufferOffset()

      • getSceneBuffer

        public int getSceneBuffer()
        the Scene lights buffer where the object is written.
        Returns:
        -1 if the object is not registered in a Scene, otherwise a valid OpenGL buffer pointer

      • setSceneBuffer

        public void setSceneBuffer(int sceneBuffer)
        Do not use this unless you really know what you're doing!
        Parameters:
        sceneBuffer -
        See Also:
        getSceneBuffer()
